posts.post_content:
I've stating a long time now that the glorious anthem was too weak and too unspecific to be truly good. Back then, I've said that a card like [Day of Destiny](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Destiny) is a MUCH better card, as well as [Muraganda Petroglyphs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Muraganda Petroglyphs). But both cards had the problem that they weren't in the "pants down" slot (= casting cost 3).   
Tempered Steel fulfills all my dreams and is worth a deck-designing card. It doesn't break the game, nor does it make you win the game, but it's a static effect that puts some pressure onto the battlefield.  
  
I hope that R&D gets the message and prints more enchantments like this.
posts.html:
I've stating a long time now that the glorious anthem was too weak and too unspecific to be truly good. Back then, I've said that a card like Day of Destiny is a MUCH better card, as well as Muraganda Petroglyphs. But both cards had the problem that they weren't in the "pants down" slot (= casting cost 3).
Tempered Steel fulfills all my dreams and is worth a deck-designing card. It doesn't break the game, nor does it make you win the game, but it's a static effect that puts some pressure onto the battlefield.

I hope that R&D gets the message and prints more enchantments like this.

posts.post_content: This card is a perfect example of how elegant the color pie is. "Artifact creatures you control get/gain..." fits in blue, and "creatures you control get +2/+2" fits in green, but if this design had cost ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) (or worse, ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green or Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=GU&type=symbol)![Green or Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=GU&type=symbol)) it would've been aesthetically unpleasant. Halfway between blue and green, in white, this design fits like a glove.
posts.html:
This card is a perfect example of how elegant the color pie is. "Artifact creatures you control get/gain..." fits in blue, and "creatures you control get +2/+2" fits in green, but if this design had cost (or worse, ) it would've been aesthetically unpleasant. Halfway between blue and green, in white, this design fits like a glove.

Posted By: RegalFantom (11/22/2010 8:48:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is at least 4.5/5. If it looks good at first glance, it passes the play test with an A+ mark. People, this baby can easily mean, in the right deck, 4 or 5 Ornithopters, 2/4 evasive flyers, by turn 3. Add some Glint Hawk Idol fun (4/4 flyer that, 90% of the time, can't be the target of sorceries), and you have yourself an the base for an original, yet competitive standard deck. I say original because your deck wont have Goblin Guides and Geopedes, like everyone else's.

posts.post_content:
I have a Myr tribal deck with [Myr Galvanizer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Galvanizer),[Myr Matrix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Matrix),and [Master of Etherium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master of Etherium) and a little healthy mana ramp Urza style. This will be the perfect addition, especially when you consider that 2x Galvanizers + [Palladium Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Palladium Myr) = Infinite Mana to pump into the Matrices, Myr's have a Myr Tutor in [Myr Turbine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Turbine), and if I'm feeling cheeky I can drop [Shimmer Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shimmer Myr) to give ALL of my artifacts flash.  
  
Myr tribal is just brutal.

Posted By: Kelptic183 (1/29/2012 11:51:32 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Tempered Steel easily tops other enchantment creature boosts ([Glorious Anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glorious Anthem), [Honor of the Pure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Honor of the Pure), [Intangible Virtue](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intangible Virtue), [Mirari's Wake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirari's Wake), with the latter being a slight exception due to having a bonus triggered ability, with a higher cost to compensate). Plenty of games I've been swarmed on turn 1 with 3+ [Memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnite)s and turn 2 or 3 this is dropped. I get hit for 9-12 damage. There are very few answers before turn 4 against this. You can either waste things like Doom Blade against a creature that will easily be replaced in another turn, or you can drop a creature of your own, but unless it's a 3 power with first strike, it's not likely to do much.
posts.html:
